Description: Fragment of handle of possibly Koan pottery transport amphora. Rectangular stamp. Clay gritty pink-buff; many white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Name Chabrias? One or more persons with this name are known from Sinopean stamps, though no attested stamp is close to this one. Also Black Sea stamps are extremely rare in Egypt. The clay is more consistent with Cyrenaica, with a preponderance of white inclusions over dark, the reverse of Sinopean fabric.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0182)
